intro: Obione aldamae, commonly known as the Aldama's obione, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
